answers.answer: All of your symptoms definitely could be from fibromyalgia.http://www.fmnetnews.com/basics-symptoms.phphttp://www.fibromyalgia-symptoms.org/fibromyalgia_treatment.html
P.S. --- I posted the latest research & treatment plans for fibromyalgia on my website. Here's the link if you want to check it out:http://groups.msn.com/Neuro-ImmuneSupport/messages.msnw

That is how i started out 1 1/2 years ago expect was dx with diabetes. then tested for nerupathy from nero. had mri and all the tests sent to rheum. and 2 dx with fibro. they put me on lryica in june 07 helped with all the burn, twitching ect going on in my feet and hands! those were the first symptoms i had. then came the pain, exhaustion hard to walk ect ... seems i get new problems as time goes on. did have another mri this week will see what happens! good luck
Thank you guys for responding.  I really appreciate it!  I will check out the websites suggested and good luck to you all with your issues too:)

question: I am at a loss as to why I have this burning feet issue.  A short history:  burning toe, then feet, then up to knees with twitching muscles all over in Aug. '06.  By Dec. '06 - I could barely drive - legs weak, burning hands burning and extreme fatigue.  Had MRIs with contrast brain and spinal cord, lumbar puncture - all neg for MS.  Neuro tested for viruses - high levels for HSV-1, CMV and HHV6 - he put me on Famvir (I had no cold sore).  The burning continued until May '07, then started to subside a little for a month. It came back full force until now - it is subsiding again.  I have to have my feet cool and I am taking Pamelor, Neurontin to help.  I am getting the fasiculations again and burning increasing again.  1.5 yr of this "idiopathic" issue is really annoying.  All bloodwork normal for B6, diabetes, celiac disease, everything incl. two nerve conduction studies WNL.  Feet burn worse at night - typical idiopathic PN a Duke pain Dr. said.  My neuro says fibro.I'm 32 yo female in medical profession - very annoyed with lack of research/understanding of PN.  It can be debilitating - does anyone have ANY insight????????
title: Peripheral neuropathy = Fibro?
